p: Ticks belong to a group of exclusively blood-feeding ectoparasites (Elmhalli et al. 2009). From the medical point of view, ticks are the second most important group of disease vectors after mosquitoes. The pathogenic agents transmitted by ticks affect the public health and cause economic losses in livestock sector (Svehlova et al. 2014). The Mediterranean region offers suitable environment for a wide range of tick species (Maia et al. 2014). The geographical distribution of ticks has continued to increase over the past three decades (Tabanca et al. 2013; Svehlova et al. 2014). This distribution might be modified by future climate and environmental changes (Jore et al. 2014).
